conditions: Primary Open-angle Glaucoma and Ocular Hypertension

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients with Primary Open-Angle Glaucoma or Ocular Hypertension in one or both eyes.
* Provide signed written informed consent.
* Diagnosis of POAG or OHT in both eyes.
* Qualifying corrected visual acuity in each eye.
* Qualifying central corneal thickness in each eye.
* Qualifying Day 1 IOP measurement at 3 time-points in both eyes after latanoprost Run-in Period.
* Qualifying Anterior chamber angle.
* Qualifying IOP measurement at 3 time-points during latanoprost Run-in Period.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients who cannot safely discontinue use of Ocular Hypotensive Medications during Washout.
* Patients with prior exposure to DE-117.
* History of ocular surgery specifically intended to lower IOP
* Advanced glaucoma in either eye.
* Any corneal abnormality or other condition interfering with or preventing reliable Goldmann applanation tonometry.
* Any ocular surgery or ocular laser treatment within 180 days prior to Visit 1 (Screening) and throughout the study in either eye.
* Females who are pregnant, nursing, or planning a pregnancy.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Mean Diurnal Intraocular Pressure (IOP) at Month 3.
outcomeMeasures.description: IOP lowering effect of DE-117 ophthalmic solution 0.002% in Latanoprost low/non-responder subjects. Mean Diurnal Intraocular Pressure: Analysis of Change from Baseline in IOP score at Month 3 using Paired T-test on Observed Case. Mean Diurnal IOP is defined as the average IOP of all three timepoints (8:00,12:00, 16:00) at Month 3.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Mean Diurnal IOP at Week 2, Week 6 and Month 3
outcomeMeasures.description: The secondary efficacy endpoint evaluated percent change from baseline in mean DIOP at week 2, 6 and month 3.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Mean Diurnal IOP at Week 2 and Week 6
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline (Visit 4) in mean diurnal IOP at Week 2 (Visit 5) and Week 6 (Visit 6).

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in IOP at Timepoints at Week 2
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in mean IOP were evaluated at each time point at all post-baseline visits. (Change from baseline measurement at each timepoint was calculated by deducting the baseline value at corresponding timepoint from the IOP measurement).

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in IOP at Timepoints at Week 6
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in mean IOP were evaluated at each time point at all post-baseline visits.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in IOP at Timepoints at Month 3
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in mean IOP were evaluated at each time point at all post-baseline visits.

outcomeMeasures.title: Intraocular Pressure: Percent Change From Baseline by Analysis Visit and Timepoint at Week 2
outcomeMeasures.description: Intraocular Pressure: Percent Change from Baseline by Analysis Visit and Timepoint.

outcomeMeasures.title: Intraocular Pressure: Percent Change From Baseline by Analysis Visit and Timepoint at Week 6
outcomeMeasures.description: Intraocular Pressure: Percent Change from Baseline by Analysis Visit and Timepoint.

outcomeMeasures.title: Intraocular Pressure: Percent Change From Baseline by Analysis Visit and Timepoint at Month 3
outcomeMeasures.description: Intraocular Pressure: Percent Change from Baseline by Analysis Visit and Timepoint.
